decks.notes: The main focus of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly. The deck uses aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to push for damage and put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and prevent them from gaining life or stabilizing. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the deck's key colors of red and white.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the aggro strategy of Death's Shadow, a powerful creature that becomes larger as the player's life total decreases. By combining efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember with disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Serum Visions to provide card advantage and consistency. Overall, the deck focuses on leveraging the power of Death's Shadow to quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victories.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a substantial amount of mana quickly. It uses various color-fixing artifacts and ramp spells to help find and play powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Karn Liberated. With access to versatile removal spells and board wipes like Dismember and Oblivion Stone, as well as game-ending threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, this deck aims to control the game and overwhelm opponents with its late-game threats.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Goblin Lore, Faithless Looting, Burning Inquiry, and Street Wraith to power out big threats like Hollow One, Gurmag Angler, and Flamewake Phoenix. The aggressive creatures like Flameblade Adept and Bloodghast help to apply pressure on the opponent while using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality to clear the way. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to consistently deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Borborygmos Enraged using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach. It also utilizes cards like Nourishing Shoal to gain life and dig for combo pieces, as well as Simian Spirit Guide to accelerate mana. Faithless Looting, Cathartic Reunion, and Night's Whisper help draw into the combo pieces while Lightning Axe and Collective Brutality provide removal and disruption. The goal is to combo off and attack with massive creatures to win the game in a single turn.

The deck focuses on quickly playing out a swarm of artifact creatures like Ornithopter and Memnite, buffing them with Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer, and finishing off the opponent with Galvanic Blast and Vault Skirge. The key strategy is to flood the board with cheap artifacts and use cards like Arcbound Ravager to sacrifice them for value, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a combination of fast aggression and efficient removal. Additionally, the deck utilizes land such as Inkmoth Nexus to provide alternative win conditions, making it a versatile and adaptable aggro deck.

This deck focuses on quickly casting low-cost aggressive creatures like Flameblade Adept and Bloodghast, while taking advantage of discard effects like Goblin Lore and Burning Inquiry to quickly fill up the graveyard and bring out powerful creatures like Hollow One. By efficiently cycling through the deck with cards like Street Wraith and Edge of Autumn, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent onslaught of creatures and direct damage spells for a swift victory.

The deck focuses on aggressively lowering your own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow while disrupting the opponent with hand disruption and removal spells. Utilizing cheap cantrips and efficient threats like Snapcaster Mage and Gurmag Angler, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent with a large Death's Shadow and finish them off with trample damage from cards like Temur Battle Rage. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to apply early pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this Modern Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly deal damage to the opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game, using cards like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to attack, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to finish off the opponent. The key strategy is to maintain a fast pace and prevent the opponent from stabilizing, ultimately winning the game through sheer aggression and direct damage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through removal spells and counterspells, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Geist of Saint Traft and Spell Queller to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to efficiently disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence with versatile threats like Celestial Colonnade and Snapcaster Mage. By combining elements of control and midrange strategies, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in order to secure victory in a 1 vs 1 matchup.

This deck focuses on quickly putting creatures on the board and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays. It utilizes mana ramp creatures like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to quickly build up its board presence. Collected Company helps to quickly bring out multiple creatures at once, while cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Tireless Tracker provide additional value as the game progresses. Gavony Township and Horizon Canopy provide additional utility to help push through damage and outvalue opponents. This deck aims to pressure opponents early and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. Key cards like Cryptic Command and Supreme Verdict help maintain board control, while cards like Search for Azcanta and Snapcaster Mage offer card advantage and flexibility. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, protect key threats like Celestial Colonnade, and grind out advantages over time. With a mix of countermagic, removal, and card draw, this deck seeks to outlast its opponents and win through incremental advantage.

The main idea of this deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck can deal damage efficiently while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Skullcrack and Eidolon of the Great Revel. The deck also includes Grim Lavamancer for additional removal and card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient damage before they have a chance to establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana, allowing for powerful plays with high-cost threats and control elements. The deck includes ramp cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to find the Urza lands quickly, as well as powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Control elements such as Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus help disrupt opponent strategies, while planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provide additional control and win conditions.

The main concept of this aggro Human deck is to have a fast and aggressive start by utilizing cards that benefit from playing multiple Humans, allowing for a quick build-up of a powerful board presence. By combining efficient creatures like Thalia, Reflector Mage, and Mantis Rider with mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Avacyn's Pilgrim, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents early on and apply pressure throughout the game. Additionally, disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter help to control the opponent's plays and disrupt their game plan.

The main idea of this Abzan Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan using spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also controlling the board with removal spells such as Path to Exile and Fatal Push. At the same time, the deck aims to apply pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Grim Flayer. Lingering Souls provides additional threats and card advantage, while cards like Scavenging Ooze and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional value and graveyard interaction. Overall, the deck aims to have a proactive game plan while disrupting the opponent's strategy.
